histogram.name: API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests
histogram.summary:
Records if various requests to access storage are allowed or not and if the Storage Access API unblocked the request or not. Recorded whenever a decision to access storage like getting/setting cookies or opening an indexeddb connection is made in CookieSettings.
This histogram erroneously recorded ALLOW when cookies were globally blocked.

histogram.name: API.StorageAccess.AllowedRequests2
histogram.summary: Records if various requests to access storage are allowed or not and if the Storage Access API unblocked the request or not. Recorded whenever a decision to access storage like getting/setting cookies or opening an indexeddb connection is made in CookieSettings.

histogram.name: API.StorageAccess.GrantIsImplicit
histogram.summary: Records if a generated grant was implicit or explicit at the time it was created.

histogram.name: API.StorageAccess.RequestStorageAccess
histogram.summary: Records requests to use document.requestStorageAccess and reasons the request may be approved or rejected.

histogram.name: Clipboard.ExtensionContentScriptReadHasUserActivation
histogram.obsolete: Removed February 2021 as enough data was collected.
histogram.summary: For calls to document.execCommand('paste') by extensions via content scripts, record the proportion of calls with user activation.

histogram.name: Clipboard.Read
histogram.summary: Counts how often each Clipboard format is read by the platform clipboard. These reads generally imply that an application requested this format after checking that the format is available, but there are some cases where Chrome reads a format to check for existence (outside the ui::Clipboard::ReadAvailableTypes() function). Please prefer interpreting these numbers as relative use changes, as opposed to absolute user usage.

histogram.name: Clipboard.RegisterClipboardFormatFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2021 as enough data was collected.
histogram.summary: Counts how often the Windows clipboard fails to register a format. Recorded when RegisterClipbaordFormat fails (returns 0). Failure rates will inform whether we implement error handling. https://crbug.com/1000919

histogram.name: Clipboard.TimeIntervalBetweenCommitAndRead
histogram.summary: Records the time interval between when clipboard data was committed to the clipboard and the same clipboard data was read from the clipboard. The same clipboard data may be read multiple times. Emitted at the moment the clipboard data was read. Currently only implemented for Chrome OS' in-memory clipboard (`ui::ClipboardNonBacked`).

histogram.name: Clipboard.Write
histogram.summary: Counts how often each Clipboard format is written by the platform clipboard. These writes all imply that an application had this format available, and therefore wrote this format.

histogram.name: Clipboard.X11StoreCopyPasteDuration
histogram.summary: The length of time that it takes to transfer ownership of Chrome's CLIPBOARD selection to the clipboard manager when Chrome exits.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.DeleteTableBackupFile
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of deleting an unused leveldb table backup file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Chromium environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MissingFiles
histogram.summary: Number of backup files found without corresponding ldb files. As measured by GetChildren when used in LevelDB clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBWrapper.CommitDelay
histogram.summary: Delay between the browser process receiving changes and those changes being written to the DB.

histogram.name: MojoLevelDBEnv.IOError
histogram.summary: Methods where leveldb's Mojo environment has IO errors.

histogram.name: NativeFileSystemAPI.FileChooserResult.{Type}
histogram.summary: The number of files a user picked using the file picker in the File System Access API. Recorded as 0 if the user cancelled the picker.

histogram.name: Sqlite.RecoveryStep
histogram.summary: Error from sqlite3_backup_step() in sql::Recovery.

histogram.name: Storage.BlacklistedImportantSites.Reason
histogram.summary: This is recorded for every site that the user blacklists when they when they clear browsing data. It indicates which signals were used to show the given site to the user that the user then chose to exclude from clearing.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.DataURLWorkerRegister
histogram.summary: Recorded when the PublicURLManager::Register method is called from a worker execution context (excluding service worker contexts). The value indicates if the worker was created from a data URL.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.DataURLWorkerResolveAsURLLoaderFactory
histogram.summary: Recorded when the PublicURLManager::Resolve URLLoaderFactory method is called from a worker execution context (excluding service worker contexts). The value indicates if the worker was created from a data URL.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.DataURLWorkerResolveForNavigation
histogram.summary: Recorded when the PublicURLManager::Resolve method for navigations is called from a worker execution context (excluding service worker contexts). The value indicates if the worker was created from a data URL.

histogram.name: Storage.FileSystemAccess.PersistedPermissions.Age.{Type}
histogram.summary: Age of a persisted permission when attempting to auto-grant via this permission.

variant.name: NonPWA
variant.summary: Origins which are not installed PWAs

histogram.name: Storage.FileSystemAccess.PersistedPermissions.Count
histogram.summary: Number of paths with permissions being persisted via the File System Access API. This is recorded shortly after instantiation of a new ChromeFileSystemAccessPermissionContext, as well as sampled periodically via a RepeatingTimer every 3 hours. See ChromeFileSystemAccessPermissionContext::UpdatePersistedPermissions() and its call sites for details.

histogram.name: Storage.FileSystemAccess.PersistedPermissions.SweepTime.{Type}
histogram.summary: Time taken to sweep persisted permissions to automatically renew permissions with active grants or revoke permissions which have expired.

histogram.name: Storage.FileSystemAccess.{OpType}PermissionRequestOutcome.{EntryType}
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to request permission to a file or directory via the File System Access API.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDChosenReason
histogram.summary: When a user chooses to blacklist one or more sites when they clear browsing data, this is recorded for every reason each chosen site was marked as important. It indicates which signals were used to show the given site to the user that the user then chose to exclude from clearing.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDChosenReasonCount
histogram.summary: This records the number of reasons each important site had that the user chose to blacklist when clearing browsing data.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDIgnoredReason
histogram.summary: When a user chooses to blacklist one or more sites when they clear browsing data, this is recorded for every reason each unchosen site was marked as important. It indicates which signals were used to show the given site to the user, which the user then ignored and did not select to blacklist from clearing data.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.CBDIgnoredReasonCount
histogram.summary: This records the number of reasons each important site had that the user chose to NOT blacklist when clearing browsing data.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.GeneratedReason
histogram.summary: Recorded when we generate a list of important sites. This can happen when the user opens the Clear Browsing Data dialog on Android, views the Storage tab in Site Settings on Android, or launches 'Manage Storage' from Android System Settings for Chrome. We record every reason each site was chosen in this metric. This means that we can report this metric multiple times for a single site.

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.GeneratedReasonCount
histogram.summary: This records the number of reasons qualifying a site for being 'important'. We record this for every site when we generate a list of important sites, described in "Storage.ImportantSites.GeneratedReason".

histogram.name: Storage.ImportantSites.GenerationTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to generate the list of 'important' sites. This list is generated when the user enters the 'Clear Browsing Dialog' or the 'Manage Space' screens for Chrome, both of which are on Android.

histogram.name: Storage.IndexedDB.PutBlobSizeKB
histogram.summary: Records the size of a blob used in an IndexedDB add/put operation. Recorded for every put operation that contains a blob.

histogram.name: Storage.IndexedDB.PutValidBlob
histogram.summary: Records if a blob intended to be used in an IndexedDB add/put operation is a valid blob. Recorded for every put operation that contains a blob.

histogram.name: Storage.InterestGroup.DBErrors
histogram.summary: Records the number of database errors that occur when accessing interest group storage.

histogram.name: Storage.InterestGroup.DBMaintenanceTime
histogram.summary:
Records the time spent performing database maintenance on the interest group storage. Recorded when maintenance is run (approximately once an hour).
Note that clients without high-resolution clocks will report 0 for very short times.

histogram.name: Storage.InterestGroup.DBSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the InterestGroup database. Collected prior to database maintenance.

histogram.name: Storage.InterestGroup.PerSiteCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of interest groups loaded for a single group owner when running an ad auction. Recorded for each owner involved in a running ad auction.

histogram.name: Storage.SessionStorage.RendererAreaCacheHit
histogram.summary: The renderer side cache hit rate metrics for new HTML5 SessionStorage DB opened.

histogram.name: Storage.SharedStorage.Database.Destruction
histogram.summary: Whether destruction was successful after a catastrophic error that occurred in Shared Storage. Recorded by SharedStorageDatabase::DatabaseErrorCallback() just after the SQLite database called RazeAndClose() and then, if it was file-backed, SharedStorageDatabase attempted to delete the file.

histogram.name: Storage.SharedStorage.Database.Error
histogram.summary: Errors that occur in Shared Storage. Recorded by SharedStorageDatabase::DatabaseErrorCallback() just before the SQLite database determines whether the error is catastrophic and handles it accordingly.

histogram.name: Storage.SharedStorage.OnShutdown.NumSqlErrors
histogram.summary: Count of SQL errors that have occurred in Shared Storage. Recorded by SharedStorageManager::RecordShutdownMetrics() when the StoragePartitionImpl is destroyed.

histogram.name: Storage.SharedStorage.OnShutdown.RecoveryFromInitFailureAttempted
histogram.summary: Whether or not the SharedStorageManager tried to recover from SharedStorageDatabase::InitStatus::kInitFailure. Recorded by SharedStorageManager::RecordShutdownMetrics() when the StoragePartitionImpl is destroyed.

histogram.name: Storage.SharedStorage.OnShutdown.RecoveryOnDiskAttempted
histogram.summary: Whether or not the SharedStorageManager tried to recover from SharedStorageDatabase::InitStatus::kInitFailure on disk. Recorded by SharedStorageManager::RecordShutdownMetrics() when the StoragePartitionImpl is destroyed.

histogram.name: Storage.StoragePressure.Bubble
histogram.summary: How did the user interact with the StoragePressure Bubble? Ignored means the user did not click on the positive button before the bubble is closed (either manually closed or when the browser closes).

histogram.name: websql.OpenDatabase
histogram.summary: Counts the number of WebSQL databases opened for secure vs insecure origins.
